home.title: Main
home.welcome: Welcome to the portal about Belarusian architects!
home.description: This portal contains biographies, photos, videos, places of activity of architects who have contributed to the architecture of Belarus.

anatoly_zheldakov.name: Zheldakov Anatoly Vladimirovich
anatoly_zheldakov.timeText0: Graduated from the Moscow Architectural Institute (MARCHI).
anatoly_zheldakov.timeText1: Worked as the chief architect of projects at the institute «Volgogradgrazhdanproekt»
anatoly_zheldakov.timeText2: Became the head of the creative workshop of the Belarusian Union of Architects
anatoly_zheldakov.timeText3: Designed the Minsk covered market Komarovksky
anatoly_zheldakov.imgText0: Anatoly Zheldakov during The Great Patriotic War
anatoly_zheldakov.description: Soviet and Belarusian architect. Honored Architect of the Republic of Belarus (1991). Awarded with medals, a diploma of the Union of Architects of the USSR.

iosif_langbard.name: Langbard Iosif Grigorievich
iosif_langbard.timeText0: Graduated from the architectural department of the Odessa Art College
iosif_langbard.timeText1: Won the all-Union competition for the best project of the Government House of the Byelorussian SSR
iosif_langbard.timeText2: He taught at the Leningrad Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture (LIPSA)
iosif_langbard.timeText3: Became the owner of the Grand Prix of the World Exhibition in Paris
iosif_langbard.imgText0: Watercolor by Joseph Langbard «Minsk». Museum of the History of Minsk.
iosif_langbard.imgText1: The building of the Academy of Sciences in Minsk
iosif_langbard.imgText2: Banknote of 100 Belarusian rubles (2000 y.) depicting the Langbard building.
iosif_langbard.description: He is one of the outstanding architects of Europe of the 20th century, whose artistic heritage had a significant impact on the development of modern architecture. His architectural works to a large extent influenced the formation of the image of the city of Minsk and are examples of Belarusian architecture.

georgy_zaborsky.name: Zaborsky Georgy Vladimirovich
georgy_zaborsky.timeText0: Graduated from the Leningrad Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture
georgy_zaborsky.timeText1: Managed the architectural and design workshops of the design institutes Belgosproekt and Minskproekt
georgy_zaborsky.timeText2: Designed a house for the family of J. Kolas
georgy_zaborsky.timeText3: Received the State Prize of the USSR
georgy_zaborsky.imgText0: Memorial plaque on the house 19-21 on Independence Ave.
georgy_zaborsky.imgText1: Suvorov School on the street. Maxim Bogdanovich (1950-1953)
georgy_zaborsky.description: The creative contribution of G. V. Zaborsky to the development of Belarusian architecture consists in the development of projects for residential and public buildings, urban planning projects, planning and development projects for rural settlements and the creation of monuments of monumental art. Of great importance in the creative heritage of the architect is the development of a national theme, which can be traced both in urban buildings of the neoclassical period, where the author actively uses the Belarusian ornament, and in rural construction in the subsequent period of work (projects of rural palaces of culture)

vladimir_isachenko.name: Isachenko Vladimir Grigorievich
vladimir_isachenko.timeText0: Graduated from the Belarusian State Polytechnic Institute (BPI)
vladimir_isachenko.timeText1: Worked as the head of the department for construction and architecture of the Grodno regional executive committee
vladimir_isachenko.timeText2: Participated in the development of forecasts for the territorial development of nine cities
vladimir_isachenko.timeText3: Awarded the title of Honored Architect of the Republic of Belarus
vladimir_isachenko.imgText2: Administrative building on the central square of Borisov
vladimir_isachenko.description: Belarusian architect. Honored Architect of the Republic of Belarus (1998). Member of the Union of Architects of the USSR (1967), Belarusian Union of Architects.

leonid_levin.name: Levin Leonid Mendelevich
leonid_levin.timeText0: Graduated from the Belarusian State Polytechnic Institute (BPI)
leonid_levin.timeText1: Participation in the creation of the park. 50th anniversary of Soviet power
leonid_levin.timeText2: Participation in the creation of the exhibition pavilion VDNH BSSR in Minsk
leonid_levin.timeText3: Director of the own creative workshop of the Unitary Enterprise «Creative workshop of architect L. Levin»
leonid_levin.imgText1: Park them. 50th anniversary of Soviet power
leonid_levin.description: Honored Architect of the Republic of Belarus, Laureate of the Lenin Prize and Lenin Komsomol Prize, Laureate of the Volgograd Komsomol Prize, twice winner of the State Prize of the Republic of Belarus, laureate of many prestigious competitions and reviews of architectural works, Academician of the International and Belarusian Academies of Architecture.

anatoly_shabalin.name: Shabalin Anatoly Andreevich
anatoly_shabalin.timeText0: Graduated from the Belarusian State Polytechnic Institute (BPI)
anatoly_shabalin.timeText2: For a complex artistic solution of the interiors of the Palace of the Republic in Minsk, he was awarded the State Prize of the Republic of Belarus
anatoly_shabalin.timeText3: Creation of a multidisciplinary cultural and sports complex «Minsk Arena»
anatoly_shabalin.imgText2: Snapshot from «Znamenki» (Anatoly Shabalin third from left)
anatoly_shabalin.description: Architect, author of the development of working drawings and interiors of the Palace of the Republic, developer of the technology of stage complexes and lighting complexes of the large and small halls, author of the engineering block of the Palace of the Republic and the master plan of Oktyabrskaya Square.
